page.title: 09NEWS BALLOON FLIGHT
page.content: ON SATURDAY 15TH JUNE 1985 I WENT TO PARK HOUSE WHICH IS ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF RAVENSTONEDALE. ANTHONY GIBSON WHO WORKS FOR BRITISH AIRWAYS PILOTED THE BALLOON. WHEN THEY MANAGED TO BLOW THE BALLOON UP WITH A FAN AND HOT AIR, ABOUT 5 CHILDREN WENT UP AT A TIME. THEY WENT UP AND CAME DOWN RATHER FAST. A LINE TETHERED THE BALLOON I THOUGHT IT WAS FANTASTIC AND I WISH I HAD WON FIRST PRIZE IN THE RAFFLE. THE PRIZE FOR THAT WAS A HALF HOUR FLIGHT AND A BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE. THAT NIGHT I HAD A NIGHTMARE. I WAS IN A TETHERED BALLOON AND THE ROPE SNAPPED.I NEARLY FELL OUT BUT JUST MANAGED TO HANG ON TO THE SNAPPED ROPE. IT STARTED GOING DOWN THE RIVER. IT HIT THE WATER AND THE WIND TOOK THE BALLOON AND IT GOT STUCK IN A TREE THEN I WOKE UP.
